channel.title: AI Security Paper Digest
channel.description: Curated papers on AI security from OpenAlex and ArXiv

item.title: Universally Unfiltered and Unseen:Input-Agnostic Multimodal Jailbreaks against Text-to-Image Model Safeguards
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces U3-Attack, a multimodal jailbreak method for T2I models
  • Uses adversarial image patches and safe paraphrases to bypass safeguards
  • Demonstrates higher success rates than prior art on commercial models

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Song Yan', 'Hui Wei', 'Jinlong Fei', 'Guoliang Yang', 'Zhengyu Zhao', 'Zheng Wamg']
  • Tags: ['jailbreaking', 'adversarial_prompting', 'multimodal', 'text_to_image']

item.title: SDEval: Safety Dynamic Evaluation for Multimodal Large Language Models
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces SDEval, a dynamic safety evaluation framework for multimodal LLMs
  • Uses text, image, and text-image dynamics to generate new benchmark samples
  • Aims to mitigate data contamination and expose safety limitations
  • Evaluated across multiple safety and capability benchmarks

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Hanqing Wang', 'Yuan Tian', 'Mingyu Liu', 'Zhenhao Zhang', 'Xiangyang Zhu']
  • Tags: ['safety evaluation', 'robustness', 'multimodal', 'dynamic benchmarking', 'adversarial testing']

item.title: SAM Encoder Breach by Adversarial Simplicial Complex Triggers Downstream Model Failures
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces VeSCA, a novel adversarial attack method targeting SAM's encoder
  • Uses simplicial complex to model shared vulnerabilities across domains
  • Incorporates domain re-adaptation for better transferability
  • Achieves 12.7% improvement over SOTA in transferable adversarial examples

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Yi Qin', 'Rui Wang', 'Tao Huang', 'Tong Xiao', 'Liping Jing']
  • Tags: ['adversarial attacks', 'transferability', 'robustness', 'security', 'red teaming', 'model extraction']

item.title: Turning Logic Against Itself : Probing Model Defenses Through Contrastive Questions
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces POATE, a new jailbreak technique using contrastive reasoning
  • Evaluates across six model families with ~44% attack success
  • Proposes Intent-Aware CoT and Reverse Thinking CoT defenses

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Rachneet Sachdeva', 'Rima Hazra', 'Iryna Gurevych']
  • Tags: ['jailbreaking', 'adversarial prompting', 'safety evaluation', 'robustness']

item.title: Fact2Fiction: Targeted Poisoning Attack to Agentic Fact-checking System
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces Fact2Fiction, the first poisoning attack framework targeting agentic fact-checking systems
  • Exploits system-generated justifications to craft malicious evidence for sub-claim verification
  • Achieves 8.9%-21.2% higher attack success rates compared to state-of-the-art attacks
  • Highlights security weaknesses in current fact-checking systems and need for defenses

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Haorui He', 'Yupeng Li', 'Bin Benjamin Zhu', 'Dacheng Wen', 'Reynold Cheng', 'Francis C. M. Lau']
  • Tags: ['poisoning attack', 'fact-checking', 'LLM security', 'red teaming', 'adversarial AI']

item.title: DINA: A Dual Defense Framework Against Internal Noise and External Attacks in Natural Language Processing
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces DINA framework for dual defense against internal noise and external attacks in NLP
  • Combines noisy-label learning and adversarial training
  • Demonstrates improved robustness and accuracy on real-world dataset

Additional Information

item.title: Quantifying Conversation Drift in MCP via Latent Polytope
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces SecMCP, a security framework for detecting conversation drift in MCP
  • Uses latent polytope modeling to identify adversarial shifts
  • Evaluated on Llama3, Vicuna, Mistral with high AUROC scores

  • Research

item.title: Beyond Uniform Criteria: Scenario-Adaptive Multi-Dimensional Jailbreak Evaluation
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces SceneJailEval, a scenario-adaptive multi-dimensional framework for jailbreak evaluation
  • Presents a comprehensive 14-scenario dataset with diverse jailbreak variants
  • Achieves state-of-the-art F1 scores of 0.917 on full dataset and 0.995 on JBB

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Lai Jiang', 'Yuekang Li', 'Xiaohan Zhang', 'Youtao Ding', 'Li Pan']

item.title: AURA: Affordance-Understanding and Risk-aware Alignment Technique for Large Language Models
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces AURA, a multi-layered framework for affordance-based safety in LLMs
  • Utilizes Process Reward Models (PRMs) for step-level evaluations
  • Combines self-critique, PRM assessments, and adaptive safety-aware decoding
  • Empirically shown to improve logical integrity and safety over existing methods

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Sayantan Adak', 'Pratyush Chatterjee', 'Somnath Banerjee', 'Rima Hazra', 'Somak Aditya', 'Animesh Mukherjee']

item.title: Guardians and Offenders: A Survey on Harmful Content Generation and Safety Mitigation
item.description:

  • Covers adversarial jailbreaking attacks, toxicity, and content moderation techniques
  • Proposes taxonomy of LLM-related harms and defenses
  • Assesses mitigation efforts including RLHF, prompt engineering, and safety alignment

Paper Type

  • Survey

item.title: Boosting Adversarial Transferability via Residual Perturbation Attack
item.description:
Summary

  • Proposes Residual Perturbation Attack (ResPA) to improve adversarial transferability
  • Uses residual gradient direction to guide perturbations towards flat loss regions
  • Demonstrates better transferability than existing methods
  • Code is available for research and testing

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Jinjia Peng', 'Zeze Tao', 'Huibing Wang', 'Meng Wang', 'Yang Wang']
  • Tags: ['adversarial attacks', 'transferability', 'black-box attacks', 'residual perturbation']

item.title: Are Large Language Models Robust in Understanding Code Against Semantics-Preserving Mutations?
item.description:
Summary

  • Evaluates LLM robustness in code understanding against semantics-preserving mutations
  • Applies 5 code mutations to test reasoning stability
  • Finds 10-50% of correct predictions are based on flawed logic
  • Models often change predictions when code is mutated

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Pedro Orvalho', 'Marta Kwiatkowska']
  • Tags: ['robustness', 'safety evaluation', 'adversarial testing', 'code understanding', 'reasoning']

item.title: No Query, No Access
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces Victim Data-based Adversarial Attack (VDBA) for attacking NLP models including LLMs without model queries or training data access
  • Creates shadow datasets using public pre-trained models and clustering to build substitute models
  • Employs hierarchical substitution model design and diverse adversarial example generation to improve attack success
  • Demonstrates high attack success rates (ASR) on LLMs like Qwen2 and GPT without API access

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Wenqiang Wang', 'Siyuan Liang', 'Yangshijie Zhang', 'Xiaojun Jia', 'Hao Lin', 'Xiaochun Cao']
  • Tags: ['adversarial attacks', 'LLM red teaming', 'model extraction', 'privacy attacks', 'robustness']

item.title: FIT-Print: Towards False-claim-resistant Model Ownership Verification via Targeted Fingerprint
item.description:

  • Proposes FIT-Print, a targeted fingerprinting paradigm.
  • Develops FIT-ModelDiff and FIT-LIME methods.
  • Shows effectiveness against false claims through experiments.

  • Research

item.title: Selection-Based Vulnerabilities: Clean-Label Backdoor Attacks in Active Learning
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces ALA, the first framework for clean-label backdoor attacks targeting active learning's acquisition functions
  • Poisons inputs to exhibit high uncertainty scores, making them more likely to be selected for labeling
  • Achieves high success rates (up to 94%) with low poisoning budgets (0.5%-1.0%) while maintaining model utility
  • Highlights the vulnerability of acquisition functions and cautions against deploying active learning in untrusted data scenarios

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Yuhan Zhi', 'Longtian Wang', 'Xiaofei Xie', 'Chao Shen', 'Qiang Hu', 'Xiaohong Guan']
  • Tags: ['data poisoning', 'security', 'backdoor attacks', 'active learning', 'adversarial attacks']
